text:
The apache2 docs suggest the following settings for mod_deflate:

 Insert filter
SetOutputFilter DEFLATE

# Netscape 4.x has some problems...
BrowserMatch ^Mozilla/4 gzip-only-text/html

# Netscape 4.06-4.08 have some more problems
BrowserMatch ^Mozilla/4\.0[678] no-gzip

# MSIE masquerades as Netscape, but it is fine
BrowserMatch \bMSIE !no-gzip !gzip-only-text/html

However, I've found that this leads to NO compression for IE(6). Changing the 
last line to 
BrowserMatch MSIE !no-gzip !gzip-only-text/html
works. 

I'd suspect \b is not treated correctly in the regex?

Best regards,
Andreas
creator: andreas.goetz.external@fujitsu-siemens.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
The docs are correct. It's a bug in mod_setenvif's optimizer ...
I'm investigating.

Fixed in 2.1 and proposed for backport into the 2.0 stable branch.
(<http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/httpd-2.0/modules/metadata/mod_setenvif.c.diff?r1=1.43&r2=1.44>)

Thanks for the report and thanks for using Apache!
creator: nd@perlig.de
